ITS Operations Lead/Salesforce Administrator - Melbourne VIC

Company Name Serco Company Location Melbourne

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 115 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

• Join Serco in this new opportunity to provide essential services
• A career opportunity like no other based in Ballarat, Victoria
• Ensure excellence in operational and service delivery

About You

You are an inspirational leader who is passionate about delivering outstanding industry standards in Salesforce Administrator ensuring all the standard processes are established and maintained. You will also have responsibility to ensure all IT services are maintained with the support of direct team members and the broader Serco ITS team.

Your solutions focused approach ensures you’re able to identify and implement appropriate corrective action. You are a respectful and professional person who demonstrates exceptional moral values in everything you do.

About the role

We are seeking an experienced ITS Operations Lead play a key role in ensuring that all services delivered within the contract meet objectives by ensuring processes, applications, software, interfaces and associated infrastructure are fully implemented and maintained up to and beyond the contract go live.

The ITS Operations Lead is responsible for the day to day management and ongoing support of IT solution based on the agreed contract deliverables with the customer. A key function of this role is to be involved in the transition-in phase of the services ensuring the implementation of the Salesforce solution meets the contract requirements and there is an effective operational acceptance process developed during transition. This role is a full-time opportunity and will require commuting to Melbourne g initially then will be based in Ballarat from mid-December onwards.

To be successful in this role, you will have

  • The highest levels of personal integrity and ethical behaviour
  • Degree qualified in Information Technology, a related discipline or demonstrates appropriate experience.
  • Significant experience as a Salesforce Administrator
  • Demonstrated experience in IT Operations, Applications or Service Delivery
  • Salesforce Certified Platform App Builder or Certified Advanced Administrator
  • ITIL certification at foundation or practitioner level Experience in managing third party vendors
  • The ability to work as part of the Transition team and ITS Program function to deliver the ICT components under the transition plan that has been agreed with the customer.
  • Ensure that the solution and technical specifications meet the customer requirements.
  • Delivers all standard operating procedures (SOP) required for the ongoing management and support of the IT services within the contract
  • Experience including technical design/development, configuration, maintenance, administration and integration of the Salesforce platform
  • Serves as primary system administrator for the Salesforce solution with 300+ users
  • Ability to handle all basic administrative functions including user account maintenance, reports and dashboards, workflows and other routine tasks for Salesforce
  • Regular internal system audits and preparation for upgrades to Salesforce and other integrated applications
  • Knowledge to develop Operational acceptance criteria and ensure these are met prior to handover to support

This is a position of trust and responsibility and to support this we will conduct a thorough probity assessment, which includes a national police check as an essential selection component for this role.

About Us

We are trusted to ensure the safety and wellbeing of people in our care across Australia’s network of immigration centres. Our team provides fully integrated services across facilities management, accommodation, catering, welfare, engagement, security, transport, and escorting. We are committed to treating people in our care with dignity and respect in a safe and secure environment.

At Serco, you’ll be part of a team of more than 50,000 people delivering essential services on behalf of governments and organisations around the world. We apply world's best practice, insights and technology across six key sectors: Citizen Services, Defence, Health, Immigration, Justice and Transport. But no matter your role or where you’re based, we each share the same goal – to bring service to life to make a positive difference every day. To learn more please visit www.serco.com/aspac

Join Us

If you are inspired to make a positive difference and would like to be considered for this opportunity, please submit your cover letter and resume by clicking the 'Apply Now' button.

Serco values of Trust, Care, Innovation and Pri de underpin everything we do. We are curious, creative and collaborative. Our people help in ways that matter.

We are committed to diversity and we encourage people from different backgrounds including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, culturally and linguistically diverse and people with disabilities to apply.

Job description


Intermediate Civil Engineer
Intermediate Engineer, Water

  • Intermediate level opportunity within the water and wastewater sector
  • Great team, great projects, flexible culture
  • Competitive remuneration and potential for shareholding


About us
Beca is one of Asia Pacific's leading multidisciplinary consultancies and has operated in over 70 countries. With around 3,000 employees, our employee owned organisation has the diversity of experience and expertise to tackle major projects. We have over 95 years' experience in successful client relationships, technical excellence & delivering award-winning project solutions.

As our geographic footprint increases further across Asia, and we respond to the ever increasing challenges facing the global water industry, our team is providing international experience, applied to local issues. Beca Water now consists of over 120 water industry engineering, design and project management specialists and is one of the largest specialised water teams operating across Asia Pacific. We have demonstrated a commitment to excellence, sustained growth and successful project completion.

We provide services to a broad range of water industry clients, including Melbourne Water, South East Water, and Western Water, and with a large project portfolio we are looking to expand our capabilities of our Melbourne based team. You will have the chance to work in a highly collaborative team that is focussed on creating a culture of creativity and innovation, developing long-term client relationships and empowering the success of our people.

About you
The ideal candidate will have a successful track record with water/wastewater projects including pumping systems and other mechanical items associated with water and/or wastewater conveyance and treatment, preferably also with experience of hydraulic modelling of pumping and piping systems. Strong experience with AutoCAD and Civil 3D will be highly regarded. We are looking for a person who will thrive working in a collaborative team environment to deliver high value solutions for our clients.

As a key member of our water engineering team, your role will be to be a part of a team delivering successful projects and will include:

  • Mechanical design of water process equipment, pump stations, piping systems and pipelines
  • Managing procurement activities for mechanical and process equipment associated with water and wastewater industries
  • Undertaking construction monitoring of water and wastewater systems in multi-disciplined projects
  • Delivering technically excellent water-related process engineering solutions to time and budget
  • Demonstrating excellent verbal and written communication skills and are self-motivated.


Apply today!
Innovation and integrity is embedded into our unique culture and is evident in everything we do, from the people we employ to the projects that we win. We are passionate about what we do and strive for technical and project excellence. If you enjoy working for an organisation that values partnership, tenacity, enjoyment and caring for its people and clients, then look no further than Beca.

Beca prides itself on supporting a diverse and inclusive culture - open to inputs from creative people of all genders, ethnicity, identity, thought and experiences.

Job description

Practice information

This vacancy sits within our Melbourne Corporate/MA team working with well regarded corporate head Chris Nikou, partners' Caroline Carnegie and John Mann.\xa0 This role will be pivotal in supporting Chris, Caroline and John in mid market deals, servicing clients' old and new, domestic and international, as well as guiding junior lawyers.\xa0 \xa0The current team is high performing and professional, who enjoy working together and having fun.\xa0\xa0

What does the role involve?\xa0

This role will be a key resource for our Melbourne Corporate/M&A team.\xa0 \xa0On a day to day basis you will have the chance to

  • act for international and domestic clients from a variety of different industries
  • advise on a range of corporate and commercial matters including Mergers and Acquisitions, private equity, joint ventures and restructures and regulatory issues
  • develop your own and existing client relationships
  • access and work with our global network of lawyers and resources
  • work with and develop the skills of our more junior lawyers
  • share your knowledge and specialist skills via our comprehensive learning and development offering and contribute to our knowledge and learning resources
  • develop your practice management skills, including finance management.

About you

We value our culture at K&L Gates and are proud of our friendly and respectful reputation. We are looking for a likeminded individual who in addition to possessing technical excellence and fantastic client service skills is able to work collaboratively in a team to get things done.

To be successful in this role you will ideally have 5 or more years post qualification experience in the M&A practice area working in a similar firm on similar matters.\xa0

The extras

Initiatives include:

  • Structured mentoring program
  • Professional development programs
  • Strategic planning program for business development
  • Momentum Program for women and men who are taking a period of parental leave and wish to stay on career track
  • 14 weeks paid parental leave for women and men
  • Flexible working options
  • Salary continuance insurance

About Us

The firm’s Australian operations provide vast knowledge of the Australian legal marketplace across a wide spectrum of industries. \xa0With lawyers located in four established offices in Australia’s leading financial and commercial centres and possessing substantial experience, K&L Gates acts for industry leaders, major corporations, capital markets participants, major financial institutions, and governments on ground-breaking legal transactions, both domestically and internationally.

For everyone at K&L Gates, our role is about our clients. \xa0They rely on us to provide insightful and practical advice on the diverse issues that affect their businesses. \xa0However, they also expect that advice to go hand-in-hand with excellent client service. \xa0The combination of our practice strength, global platform, and unwavering commitment to unsurpassed client service is a true differentiator in the legal services marketplace.

Company:
My client is widely regarded as a leader in their field, this reputation has come about because of the quality of their service offering and their genuine love of the industry! This is a newly created role and it will give the successful applicant opportunity to shape the finance function, systems and processes for the future. At ABB we’re committed to providing a safe and healthy work environment to all our staff, to our customers and to our communities. We are serious about Health, Safety and the environment which is why our customers choose to do business with us and why our employees choose to work for us. As a HSE/Q Specialist, you will be responsible for improving the Occupational Health, Safety, Environment and Quality (HSEQ) by applying in-depth HSEQ knowledge to offer solutions and advice. You will ensure effective risk management and assist with improvement of all processes through HSEQ excellence along ABB’s value chain.
Tasks
Reporting to the National Service Manager, your key areas of responsibility include, but are not limited to:
  • Providing necessary information, training and support to improve the HSEQ performance and culture.
  • Collecting and analyzing HSEQ performance and reporting progress on the implementation of ABB Group Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).

  • Inspecting monitoring and evaluating the site HSEQ programs
  • Conducting investigations/surveys of incidents and non-conformances. Additionally, you will have experience instilling a zero harm safety culture and developing safe working practices and programs as well as promoting early injury management intervention.

    Requirements

    Key Requirements:
  • Minimum 5 years ‘of experience in Occupational Health, Safety and Environment
  • Good understanding of, ISO 9001, ISO 14001, AS/NZS 4801/OHSAS 18001 and related Standards

Trainee Territory Sales Manager

Company Name Ritchie Bros. Company Location Corio, AU

New Posted Date Posted 19 hours ago Number of views 21 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Move, Build, Grow your career!

As the premier global asset management and disposition company, Ritchie Bros. helps thousands of people around the world buy and sell heavy equipment, trucks, and other assets every month. With our multiple onsite and online selling platforms and commitment to first-class customer service, Ritchie Bros. is trusted worldwide for making buying and selling easy, efficient, fair, and transparent. If you’re an innovator with an entrepreneurial spirit, we want you to join our growing team – employed in a wide variety of positions from sales to operations to corporate functions – as we transform the global used equipment market.

Join us on our journey and move forward with us, build your success, and grow your career.

Looking for a career in sales but you have limited work experience? Interested in the earning potential of managing a multi-million-dollar territory? Do you have aspirations to travel with a global company and grow with an industry leader?

If so, this 12-month intensive Sales Graduate Program may be for you. You’ll be thoroughly trained to become a Territory Sales Manager (outside sales rep) for Ritchie Bros. Auctioneers. As a Trainee Territory Sales Manager you’ll be given hands-on learning, surrounding every aspect of the auction business. Students in their final year of studies are eligible to participate in this program part-time as Sales Interns. Ultimately grooming you to become a successful member of our top-tier sales team!

The Opportunity

One of our objectives of the Sales Graduate Program is to provide you with the following opportunities:

  • Culture

    • In order to successfully work within our organization and represent Ritchie Bros. to our customers; it is important to first observe, experience and ultimately adopt and live what we define as our corporate culture. Internally we often refer to it as “living orange”.

  • Auction Operations

    • Learn all aspects of the auction yard, including health and safety, yard management, customer service, refurbishment and financial accountability, equipment knowledge, contract management and more.

  • Sales Operations

    • Learn how to effectively conduct appraisals and inspections to establish value for equipment; understand legal requirements & contractual aspects of business appraisals. Drive outbound call campaigns to actively develop qualified leads and generate new business opportunities. Learn how to become a Trusted Advisor and an expert at putting your time and energy where it will have the most impact.

    Here’s What You Bring
    • Post-secondary education and Master’s studies are a strong asset, ideally you have graduated in a major of Sales, Marketing, Commerce, Business Admin, Construction, or Agriculture. If you are still in your 4th year of studies – no problem, let us know and we’ll consider a part-time internship in this program.
    • We need you to be adventurous and mobile. We may ask you to relocate up to twice: once for training, and once more into a permanent territory in another city or region (Click here to check out our auction site locations.)
    • You have a track-record of setting your own goals, and then meeting or beating them -- but you never sacrifice your personal integrity along the way.
    • You have experience on an organized sports team, running your own small business or direct work experience in an outside sales position preferred.
    • You thrive on relationships and have a natural curiosity about everyone you meet.
    • You’re a self-starter. Sitting still and waiting to be told what to do next just isn’t in your nature.
    • Excellent verbal, written and listening skills in English.

    It’s Important To Note That
    • This is not an “8 to 5” job. As an event-driven company, overtime is a major part of what we do.
    • Overnight travel will be required up to 50% of the time.
    • You'll have to maintain a valid driver’s license and a clean driving record.
    • You must be able to work outside for extended periods in all types of weather.
    • You must be able to climb on top of and under large construction equipment.

    What We Offer

    Our success is built on the drive and dedication of our people. As we grow around the world, there will be many opportunities to advance your career – we’ve proven this throughout our 60+ years in business. And, we’ll make sure we help you achieve your own goals along the way. We offer our Trainee Territory Sales Managers a competitive compensation package that includes:

    Trainee Territory Manager - Full-time Regular
    • Competitive base salary, paid overtime & comprehensive benefits.
    • Ongoing sales training and professional development.
    • Tuition reimbursement program.
    • Working in a stable and growing company
    • An international working environment
    Sales Intern - Part-time Temporary
    • Hourly salary
    • Ongoing sales training and professional development.
    Want to learn more about the company? Visit our Career site, LinkedIn or connect with us today through Facebook or Twitter.

    Established in 1958, Ritchie Bros. (NYSE and TSX: RBA) is a global asset management and disposition company, offering customers end-to-end solutions for buying and selling used heavy equipment, trucks and other assets. Operating in a multitude of sectors, including construction, transportation, agriculture, energy, oil and gas, mining, and forestry, the company’s selling channels include: Ritchie Bros. Auctioneers, the world’s largest industrial auctioneer offers live auction events with online bidding; IronPlanet, an online marketplace with featured weekly auctions and providing its exclusive IronClad Assurance\xae equipment condition certification; Marketplacee, an online marketplace offering multiple price and timing options; Mascus, a leading European online equipment listing service; and Ritchie Bros. Private Treaty, offering privately negotiated sales. The company also offers sector-specific solutions including GovPlanet, TruckPlanet, Kruse Energy Auctioneers, and Cat\xae auctions, plus equipment financing and leasing through Ritchie Bros. Financial Services. For more information about the unprecedented choice provided by Ritchie Bros., visit RitchieBros.com.

    Ritchie Bros. is an equal opportunity employer and ensures nondiscrimination in all activities in accordance with all applicable laws. This position is open to all qualified applicants who are legally entitled to work in the country in which this job is located. Candidate selection is made by Talent Acquisition. Only electronic applications can be accepted. No agency calls please.

Local Business Banker - South Coast

Company Name Westpac Group Company Location Dandenong, AU

New Posted Date Posted 22 hours ago Number of views 22 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Westpac Business Bank

The purpose of the Business Bank at Westpac is to support one of Australia’s most important assets – its businesses. We’re here to make Australian businesses stronger.

Now more than ever Australian businesses look to people who understand how a business can bank on the future.

About Our Opportunity

Local Business Banker is a customer facing sales role, specialising in the small to medium enterprise (SME) business segment in their local market. SME is defined as business entities with an annual turnover of up to $5 million.

Reporting to the Regional General Manager, the Local Business Bankers is accountable for the entire SME customer experience in their local market, managing a portfolio of SME customers, focussing on delivering both their business and consumer needs.

The Local Business Banker is an expert across the full spectrum of SME banking needs, including business and consumer, cash flow, transactional, lending and payments. Working as the local dedicated contact for the SME market, the LBB partners effectively with small to medium businesses as well as key local business influencers, community groups and referral partners to deliver a difference for both Westpac and the local community

What We Need From You
  • Take accountability for building relationships and managing a portfolio of up-to 200 small-to-medium enterprise business customers
  • Deepen relationships by having needs based conversations across the full spectrum of your customers banking needs, from cash flow to transaction, lending to payments, business and consumer
  • Sell Westpac’s financial products and provide professional financial advice by meeting with customers and deepen customer relationships through quality needs based conversations, exploring customers financial needs and goals
  • Understand the local business market, providing advice based on local and business knowledge. At every available opportunity talk to local businesses, understand their customer base, business drivers, trends etc. Build business acumen and provide advice based on individual customer needs identified and met
The successful candidate will have proven business banking experience and passion for sales delivery. You will possess effective relationship management skills with a developed financial acumen and a passion for delighting customers.

Why this role is for you

The Local Business Banker plays a critical role within the business & within the local community. You’ll be given accountability to run your own business while being supported throughout the entire lifecycle.

Our Westpac SME Banking leadership team are visible, accessible and highly engaged. Our leaders are some of the best in the industry and completely focused on their teams delivering a better banking experience for our customers.

It goes without saying our opportunity provides a fantastic platform for career prospects. At Westpac Group we realise everyone has career aspirations and we actively support our people at every opportunity.

The perks
  • Entitled to a suite of online learning, training modules and career planning tools to grow with us
  • Encouraged to participate in the community through paid volunteer leave and secondments available
  • Offered a highly competitive remuneration that is fair and consistent for all our people
  • Access to some of the best banking, wealth and insurance benefits in the market
Our Commitment to you

At The Westpac Group, we have a vision to be one of the world's great companies for helping our people, customers and communities to prosper and grow. We aim to be leaders in diversity, flexibility and as an equal opportunity employer.

As part of our commitment to creating a flexible, diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to experienced candidates seeking workplace flexibility. We invite applications from men and women of all ages including people with a disability and indigenous Australians to apply.

Where to from here?

If you would like to know more please contact Richard from the Westpac Group recruitment team on +61 434 803 639 or Richard.maher@westpac.com.au

Job description

Reporting to the Project manager, you will be responsible for planning, organising and directing the project controls and planning function. You will be providing project controls expertise, systems, and procedures for the same and timely delivery of projects.
Planning Manager - Melbourne

CPB Contractors is a leading international construction company and a member of the CIMIC Group.

We combine the construction track record and expertise formerly delivered by Leighton Contractors and Thiess, and we also include the people and projects of Leighton Asia.

In conjunction with our clients and partners, CPB Contractors is delivering important and iconic projects across all key sectors of the construction industry, meaning we offer significant and diverse work opportunities.

We are building on the strong foundations of our unique history to create a successful and sustainable future. Safely delivering next-generation infrastructure that better connects people and transforms communities is at the heart of what we do.

Your opportunity

Reporting to the Project manager, you will be responsible for planning, organising and directing the project controls and planning function. You will be providing project controls expertise, systems, and procedures for the same and timely delivery of projects.

As a Planning Manager, You Will Be Accountable For
  • Review of the planning processes and procedures on a regular basis to ensure that they meet the business needs and future requirements
  • Ensuring that the processes and procedures are adhered to by the planning engineers working on both bids and live projects
  • Undertaking an independent audit of live projects to ensure procedures are being adhered to and that the high-level project programs are realistic
  • Where contracts are awarded, ensuring a comprehensive handover of the Project to the Construction Team to ensure the Project Team are adequately briefed with regard to the program fundamental principles and details set out in the tender program
  • Ensuring these principles are transferred to the construction phase of the project
  • Assessing levels of confidence for the achievement of key milestones
  • Monitoring actual progress (at work package level), compare to baseline and report progress against schedule
  • Providing scheduling support and schedule analysis of various interfaces of the project
  • Assisting in the management & coordination of the interrelationships between activities on the projects
  • Assisting the Project Manager to review impacts, test scenarios & propose solutions to competing programme demands


Our Minimum Requirements For This Role Are
  • Extensive experience in project controls environment
  • Detailed experience in controls & planning, document control, and quality systems & processes
  • Proven communication and presentation skills
  • Strong leadership skills
  • Suitable experience on mega-projects
  • Experience with Primavera

If you are interested in these roles and meet the above requirements, please apply below.

We support diversity in the workplace. Women, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders and people with a multicultural background are strongly encouraged to apply.

Job description

Novotech is internationally recognised as the leading independent and full service contract research organisation (CRO) in the Asia Pacific region. We provide a wide range clinical development services across all research phases and therapeutic areas; and have been instrumental in the success of hundreds of Phase I – IV clinical trials throughout the Asia Pacific.

Powered by the highest quality people, Novotech strives to set the benchmark for both business and clinical trial performance.

Our people are one of our key strengths. We value our people and recognise the work they do. We are lucky to have the best people and talent from across the Asia Pacific region work together to deliver to clinical trial success for our clients.

Our people and those we look to recruit have an attitude of making things happen. They are problem solvers, driven with a focus on delivering quality, accountability and a high level of performance.

About the position\xa0

Due to a strong project pipeline and an influx of client work, we are currently seeking a talented Clinical Research Associate to join our Sydney team as a CRAII, CRAIII or SCRA. \xa0

Core responsibilities:

Acting as the primary link between sites and sponsor, you will be responsible for:

  • Acting as a site manager to ensure that clinical trials are conducted and documented as per ICH GCP guidelines, global and local regulatory requirements and Novotech/Client SOPs;
  • Providing mentorship to less experienced staff;
  • Providing support to the project manager as required; and
  • Performing site selection visits to ensure sites have adequate resources to conduct studies.

Required Qualification(s):

  • Tertiary qualifications in clinical or life sciences related field (relevant experience/qualifications in similar professions may also be considered);

Required Professional Experience:

  • At least 18 months of independent monitoring experience;
  • Solid knowledge of GCP, national and international regulations and a sound understanding of how they apply to you;
  • Excellent interpersonal and team skills with a genuine commitment to contributing to the development of innovative treatments;
  • Previous experience in monitoring oncology trials would be highly desirable; and
  • A strong track record of performing visits to sites according to the Clinical Monitoring Plan

Opportunities and benefits

To deliver clinical trial and research excellence for our clients, our people are 'best in class'.

At Novotech, we seek and nurture people with exceptional talent. We are committed to providing our people with regular internal and external training, a competitive bonus structure and a supportive work environment. We are also focused on providing our people with a wide variety of career growth and development opportunities.

For more information about where your next career step at Novotech might take you, visit http://novotech-cro.com/novotech-careers\xa0

Digital Account Coordinator

Company Name carsales.com.au Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 49 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • ASX top 100 with the heart of a start up
  • Passionate about supporting a diverse & inclusive workplace culture
  • Work for Forbes' #12 most innovative growth company in the world

Got drive? You’ll fit right in.

In 1997 we tried something new - we've been doing it ever since. From humble start-up beginnings, today we're an ASX top 100 with world-class technology and advertising solutions. Not only are we the largest online automotive, motorcycle and marine classifieds business in Australia, we're growing across Latin America and Asia.

The role

Reporting to the Group Account Director as an Account Coordinator, you’ll be responsible for providing exceptional support to our advertising agency team. Your focus will be on helping them do their job to the best of their ability so that we can deliver the best possible experience to our customers. Essentially, we want you to become an invaluable resource that the team can’t live without! In turn, you’ll have the opportunity to work with a group of amazing people who are highly innovative and thought leaders in their field.

If you’re a recent grad looking for that all important foot in the door, this could be the opportunity that you’ve been looking for. But don’t get us wrong, you don’t have to be a recent grad to apply for this role - we’re simply looking for someone who has a passion for digital and online media who’s ready for the challenge of learning on the job.

What You’ll Do
  • Work closely with the team and provide a range of administrative support to ensure that all advertising campaigns are delivered according to the brief provided.
  • Liaise with advertisers and agencies to oversee proper implementation of campaigns.
  • Collate data rich reports to be shared with stakeholders via weekly, end of month, and end of campaign reports.
  • Assist in fostering strong relationships with advertisers, agencies and other clients.
What we’re looking for
  • Degree qualified in Business, Communications, Marketing, Commerce or a similar discipline.
  • Tech savvy, comfortable learning new online systems, and a proficient user of Microsoft Office products.
  • A can-do, proactive attitude – you’re happy to get involved with any task required to get the job done.
  • A confident communicator who can build sustainable relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
  • Ability to multitask, pay attention to the tiniest of details, and combine analytical and creative thinking to solve problems.
  • Eager for the challenge of learning on the job.
Why apply?

carsales offers extensive opportunities to learn and evolve in a diverse, fast-paced and dynamic environment. We are committed to our people through many ongoing initiatives associated with culture and benefits, career development, health and well-being, community, work-life balance, reward and recognition. We continually strive to attract and retain the most talented people through a number of programs designed to support learning and development. When you work at carsales you don't just have a job, but you have a rewarding career.

carsales is an equal opportunity employer who prides themselves on providing a diverse workplace that brings out the best in its people. We encourage women and men of all ages and background to apply.



  • And just a quick one…
    Successful candidates joining the carsales family are required to undergo a National Police Record check and must have full-time Australian working rights on an ongoing basis.

Demand Manager B2B

Company Name Asaleo Care Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 45 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Organisation

Asaleo Care is built on strong traditions. Past generations have worked tirelessly to build our knowledge, best-in-class technology, market leading brands and customer relationships.

When you join us you become part of a team of 1,000 employees working across Australia, New Zealand and the Pacific Islands. We are proud of our brands and what we can achieve together. With pride and passion, we move forward. We are always seeking to do things better.

What sets us apart is a strong ethos of taking care. Nothing is more important than taking care of our consumers, customers, communities, shareholders, each other and the environment.

We roll-up our sleeves and support one another to succeed. Our people gain exposure to a wide range of work and projects and are involved every step of the journey. We strive for results and work hard to achieve our common goals. Our diverse and inclusive environment fosters ideas and innovation whilst growing and developing your career.

We know you'll find Asaleo Care to be a workplace where everyone is welcome.

We are always seeking talented people to join our team and help us grow.

Are you ready to make difference?

The Role

We currently have an opportunity for an experience Demand Manager to join Asaleo Care's Demand Planning division. Reporting to the General Manager S&OP this position is a pivotal role ensuring the delivery of an aligned 18-month Demand Plan within the Integrated Business Management process as well as converting customer-level sales trends and assumptions into regional-level forecasts.

You will work closely with Category Managers, Finance, Supply Planning and Logistics as well as Sales and Marketing teams to ensure stock availability, inventory and service level targets are achieved. The product range is diverse including both locally and imported finished goods.

The Demand Manager will add significant value to the business through ongoing analysis of trends, customers, competitors, pricing and processes to allow continuous improvement in both demand and wider business plans.

The Person

To be considered for this position you will have demonstrated experience in demand management ideally within the B2B sector with significant experience in SAP demand planning. You will be able to demonstrate an understanding of supply chain concepts and ideally commodity sales via distributors.

The successful candidate will have highly developed analytical skills and be highly proficient within Excel. With a can do attitude you will enjoy managing dynamic conditions & multiple stakeholders throughout the demand process.

What's in it for you?

This is an opportunity to be part of this highly successful organisation. We have a large number of tier one brands which gives you a strong platform to see your day to day work in consumer homes. Come and join us to be part of this success story.

Contact the job poster

Emma Yates

HR Manager at Asaleo Care

HR Business Partner

Company Name SOTI Company Location Glen Waverley, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 20 hours ago Number of views 50 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

SOTI’s growth and success is a result of commitment to innovation through entrepreneurial culture and leadership. Employees are driven to make an impact, offer a unique value and most importantly, be part of a winning team. As a part of the Human Resources team, you’ll have the opportunity to work with all levels of staff to influence change and make SOTI a top employer. This role offers incredible growth opportunities for those who take ownership and thrive in a fast-paced environment.

\xa0

Responsibilities:

  • Proactively handle all employee relations issues with staff and management

  • Keep up-to-date on applicable HR legislation and make recommendations for enhancements to employee handbooks

  • Work with Managers to coach, discipline and develop employees

  • Work with Managers on goal development and tracking for employees

  • Work with Legal team on development of contracts, policies and all employment law matters

  • Manage exit process including terminations, exit interview and all documentation

  • Provide guidance and direction to junior level HR team members

  • Administration and enhancement of existing HR programs

  • Develop, implement and administer new HR programs

  • Assist with the development and promotion of the SOTI Employer Brand and Value Proposition, both internally and externally

  • Work with leadership on process improvements and facilitating changes \xa0

  • Work with members of the HR team on learning and development initiatives, talent acquisition events and projects and other projects as assigned


Qualifications:

  • 5+ years of experience in HR role

  • MBA full time in Human Resources or related discipline

  • Experience with HRIS, strong preference for Workday

  • Demonstrates a strong knowledge of organizational change, culture transformation process and change management

  • Ability to prioritize high volume of projects

  • Ability to manage and complete tasks from start to finish

[

Assistant Director - Planning & Environment

Company Name Housing Industry Association (HIA) Company Location East Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 13 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The organisation

The Housing Industry Association is Australia’s peak residential building industry body. As a national industry organisation, HIA’s primary role is to represent and advance the interests of its members. We currently have an opportunity for an experienced town planner to join our Victorian team.

\xa0

The role

As the Assistant Director Planning & Environment you will enjoy a real opportunity to provide innovative policy advice and practice guidance to members of the Victorian housing industry. \xa0

\xa0

You will be responsible for providing professional advice to members on a range of environmental, planning and development issues. You will also be responsible for working closely with a range of government departments and industry stakeholders to put forward the housing industry’s position on policy and legislation. To assist in this, you will be required to research, develop and articulate relevant policy and strategies to advance the interests of the housing industry.

\xa0

You will attend a variety of meetings and business forums and prepare submissions to State Government and Councils on planning policy and related matters. You will also have the opportunity to prepare articles for publication, online information and deliver presentations for HIA members.

\xa0

You will provide key support to the Victorian Executive Director, HIA’s Planning and Environment Committee and be part of a national planning and building team.

\xa0

The person

To be successful in this role you will have an excellent knowledge of the Victorian planning approval processes, local government and state policy and legislation related to the home building and residential land development.

\xa0

The successful applicant will also possess outstanding communication skills, impeccable writing skills and industry appreciation to make this unique opportunity your own through professional advice and service to members. Ideally you will have completed a degree in a relevant discipline such as urban planning, environmental planning, or building and have several years of experience.


A full job description can be found in the Careers section of our website, hia.com.au.

\xa0

HIA employees enjoy a variety of benefits including the option to salary sacrifice up to two weeks annual leave, study assistance program, paid maternity leave and group insurance cover. HIA employees are also able to access HIA member benefits such as HIA Vehicles, HIA Telecommunications and Corporate Health Insurance Plans.

\xa0

If you are interested in joining the HIA team please submit your application by 1 October 2018 by clicking on the link to apply.
